file_content.text: I don't recommend you waste any time. Those turbolasers will be complete soon. Hurry to the assault shuttle.
Haven't seen you since Darth Angral became a cloud of random molecules. Glad you joined the festivities. This gathering is long overdue.
This isn't a celebration. People are dying out there, doctor.
It's a war, not a party.
As long as it's the right people dying, that's not a problem for me.
Doctor Godera, this is a war zone--are you trying to get yourself killed?
You shouldn't be here.
Honestly, who's going to target a science museum? Besides, the general's best men are guarding me.
You seem familiar. Have we met?
Who are you?
I've put on a little weight since Taris, but... Doctor Godera, remember?
My probe droids have been hunting for your Master Braga. They've found enemy activity in two buildings bordering Axial Park.
Teams of Sith under Master Braga's command are setting up turbolasers in the buildings' topmost floors. They're camouflaging the weapons from view.
Whatever they're planning, it's designed to be a surprise.
Sounds like a sneak attack.
Is Master Braga personally overseeing this operation? Can I get to him?
Is he with them?
The Sith are only taking orders via holo, but I'm closing in on the source of those transmissions.
Send artillery to level those structures. Threat eliminated.
Bomb the buildings.
I admire your plan's simplicity, but both buildings contain thousands of civilian inhabitants.
The turbolasers are code-named "firestorm." An adaptation of the technology from Darth Angral's superweapon. Lethal and focused.
Those turbolasers will make Axial Park a literal inferno. There would be no survivors.
The Emperor wants to inflict maximum fatalities here. We need to take out those weapons fast.
That's the enemy's goal.
I doubt the enemy soldiers on the ground have been notified of this plan by their Sith masters.
And a lot of dead Imperials.
Seems the Empire's left claw doesn't know what the right claw is doing.
If we took control of those turbolasers, we could incinerate the whole Imperial army.
We could use those weapons.
The fires created would be too intense. They'd spread out of control and consume whole sectors.
General Var Suthra wants those turbolasers destroyed. As I'm currently standing in the line of fire, I'm inclined to agree.
Demolitions and transport have been secured. All we need is a small commando group. I'm told you can provide that.
Just point us at the targets.
Yes, I can.
Can't we just enter these buildings from the ground floor?
We need a transport?
The structures are thousands of meters high. You'd be exhausted before you reach the enemy positions.
Just like old times. The Republic finds a problem, and I have to go fix it.
Don't I always?
Doing it the opposite way never seems to work out.
Republic military transports can't get off the ground here, but there's an Imperial assault shuttle on display at a starship museum nearby.
The enemy doesn't know the Corellians have it. They'll mistake the assault shuttle for one of their own. You'll fly directly to your targets.
Impressive plan, doctor. Let's put it into action.
Let's get moving.
You say the transport is in a museum. Does it actually fly?
You're sure the shuttle works?
Corellians love starships even more than museums. The assault shuttle is in pristine condition.
After we hit the first turbolaser, the enemy will be onto us. They'll start gunning for our transport.
And blow our cover.
I never said the plan was foolproof. You're a Jedi. Fly recklessly.
One last thing... I've modified some proton torpedos into explosive charges. Drop one down a turbolaser's barrel and you'll fuse it shut. Weapon neutralized.
Get to the shuttle. Stop the Sith before they turn this park into a giant cookout. Good luck.
Do me a favor when you leave. Kill every Imperial and Sith you see.
We will secure fuel for the shuttle and prep it for takeoff. It will be ready to fly when you meet us.
